title: 11 Ways to Get Rid of Paint Smells

steps.title: Fresh air helps clear out the lingering smell of paint fumes.
steps.content: Fresh air helps clear out the lingering smell of paint fumes. If your room’s layout (as well as the weather) permits, open up a few windows to let some fresh air circulate through the painted space. Leave them open until the smell of fumes goes away completely. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Fans help circulate the air and get rid of the bad smell.
steps.content: Fans help circulate the air and get rid of the bad smell. Plug in a fan or two (or however many you can fit) into your painted space. Switch them on to help get the air moving around so it can deodorize the room . Leave the fans on until you can smell a difference in your room’s air quality. [2] X Research source For extra deodorizing power, open up a couple of your windows, too!

steps.title: Bowls of vinegar help clear away the stench of paint fumes.
steps.content: Bowls of vinegar help clear away the stench of paint fumes. Grab a bottle or jug of white vinegar and pour it into a few bowls. Then, put these bowls all around your room, leaving them there until the paint stench completely fades away. [3] X Research source If you aren’t a fan of the vinegar scent either, add a few drops of essential oils (like lavender oil ) to each bowl. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Freshen up your living space with a homemade deodorizer.
steps.content: Freshen up your living space with a homemade deodorizer. Dump 1 cup (272 g) of baking soda into a clean mason jar, as well as 15 drops of your desired essential oil . To really boost the fresh scent, mix in 1 tsp (2 g) of dried herbs (like rosemary or basil ), too. Replace the lid and shake everything together to incorporate it all together; then, pour the mixture into a bowl and set it out in the fume-filled room until the bad smell goes away. [5] X Research source Make multiple bowls of this deodorizing mixture to achieve max benefits. Don’t have any herbs or essential oils lying around? Set out a few dishes of plain baking soda instead.

steps.title: The onion slices help eliminate the paint stench from your space.
steps.content: The onion slices help eliminate the paint stench from your space. Peel away the outer layer of a medium- or large-sized white or yellow onion. Slice each onion in half, placing each chunk cut-side-up in a bowl. Set these bowls down on opposite ends of the smelly room and leave them overnight (or until the paint smell has completely dissipated). [6] X Research source Toss out the onions once the room is deodorized—make sure that no one eats them!

steps.title: Leave out bowls of this mixture for a deodorizing kick.
steps.content: Leave out bowls of this mixture for a deodorizing kick. Fill up 3 or more bowls with tap water, adding a slice of lemon and ¼ cup (59 mL) of salt to each one. Place the bowls all around a room that’s recently been painted. Let these bowls sit out overnight, or until the paint smell has gone away completely. [7] X Research source Toss out the homemade mixture once your room is deodorized.

steps.title: Diatomaceous earth is a popular household deodorizer.
steps.content: Diatomaceous earth is a popular household deodorizer. Pour food-grade diatomaceous earth into containers and set them around the room. Any leftover or unused containers you have lying around your home work well for this. Set the containers out in the smelly room, leaving them out until the stench clears away. Diatomaceous earth is most commonly used for small-scale deodorizing projects, like airing out a pair of shoes or refrigerator, but there’s no harm in using it for larger-scale projects, like a living space. [8] X Research source The FDA considers diatomaceous earth as a “generally safe” product, but still opt for the food-grade variety whenever you can, as it’s gone through a purification process.

steps.title: Low VOC paints won’t create as many paint fumes in the future.
steps.content: Low VOC paints won’t create as many paint fumes in the future. Materials like paint typically have VOC, or Volatile Organic Compounds—these are responsible for the nasty fumes you often smell after painting your space. To prevent any lingering fumes, choose a low VOC paint to get the job done. [9] X Research source

steps.title: The lemon water helps deodorize your space and gives it a refresh.
steps.content: The lemon water helps deodorize your space and gives it a refresh. Grab a big bucket or cooking pot and fill it up most of the way with water. Then, dump a handful of fresh lemon slices into the water and stick the mixture somewhere in your freshly-painted room. Each day, switch out the bucket with fresh water and lemon slices until the bad odors clear away.

steps.title: The coffee helps soak up the nasty paint smell in your room.
steps.content: The coffee helps soak up the nasty paint smell in your room. Grind up your whole coffee beans , transferring the grounds into two or more bowls as needed. Stick all the bowls around a room that you recently painted and let them sit overnight, or until the paint smell has dissipated. [10] X Research source Toss out the old coffee grounds once they’ve soaked up the paint fumes.

steps.title: Activated charcoal can absorb the foul paint smell in your space.
steps.content: Activated charcoal can absorb the foul paint smell in your space. Grab a few large bowls and fill them up with activated charcoal , which is great at soaking up bad smells. Arrange these bowls all around the fume-filled space, leaving them out until they absorb the nasty smell. [11] X Research source Feel free to just stick opened sacks of activated charcoal in a space instead of pouring it out. Did You Know? You can make your own activated charcoal at home.
